title: color:transparent;
body: Applies a transparent color to the text. The text will still take up the space it should.

title: color:red;
body: You can use one of the 140+ color names.

title: color:#05ffb0;
body: You can use hexadecimal color codes.

title: color: rgb(50, 115, 220);
body: You can use rgb() color codes: the first value is for red, the second value is for green y the third value is for blue.Each of them can have a value between 0 and 255.

title: color: rgba(50, 115, 220, 0.3);
body: You can use rgba() color codes: the first 3 values are for rgb y the 4th value is for the alpha channel and defines the opacity of the color.The alpha value can go from zero 0 (transparent) to one 1 (opaque).

title: color: hsl(14, 100%, 53%);
body: You can use hsl() color codes: the first value is for hue and can go from 0 to 359, the second value is for saturation and go from 0% to 100% y the third value is for luminosity and go from 0% to 100%

title: color: hsla(14, 100%, 53%, 0.6);
body: You can use rgba() color codes: the first 3 values are for hsl y the 4th value is for the alpha channel and defines the opacity of the color.The alpha value can go from zero 0 (transparent) to one 1 (opaque).
